clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Safety and Efficacy of a Basiliximab, Mycophenolate Mofetil, Cyclosporine Microemulsion and Prednisone Combination Treatment Regimen in Pediatric Renal Allograft Recipients
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Placebo-controlled, Double-blind, Multicenter Study Investigating Basiliximab in Combination With MMF, Cyclosporine Microemulsion and Prednisone in the Prevention of Acute Rejection in Pediatric Renal Allograft Recipients

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is assess the safety and efficacy of the treatment regimen of basiliximab ,cyclosporine microemulsion, MMF, and prednisone combined compared to cyclosporine microemulsion, MMF and prednisone in the time to first biopsy proven acute rejection episode or treatment failure during the first 6 months post-transplantation in pediatric renal allograft recipients.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to first BPAR episode or treatment failure
primary_outcome.description: Treatment failure is defined as: graft loss, death, or initiation of anti-rejection therapy without prior biopsy-proven rejection (in case of medical contraindication for a biopsy).

arm_group.description: Patients will be on a regimen of Basiliximab, MMF, cyclosporine and steroids
Patients will be on a regimen of MMF, cyclosporine and steroids.

intervention.intervention_name: basiliximab, MMF(mycophenolate mofetil), cyclosporine, prednisone (or equivalent)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are recipients of primary or secondary renal allograft.
- Patients who are single-organ recipients (kidney only).
